clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational, Epidemiological Study on the Prevalence of Human Papillomavirus Types in Women in Egypt
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational, Epidemiological Study on the Prevalence of Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Types in Women >= 18 Years of Age, in Egypt

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine the Human Papillomavirus (HPV) prevalence and HPV type distribution among women aged >= 18 years, attending out-patient health services for gynaecological examination and who agree to HPV testing in Egypt .

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Human papillomavirus (HPV) DNA and of any of the HPV types among women undergoing cervical sample testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of HPV DNA and of any of the HPV types among women of different age-strata undergoing cervical sample testing
Behavioural risk factors assessed by behavioral questionnaire
Assessing the awareness of HPV in relation to transmission and cause of cervical cancer

arm_group.description: Subjects attending out-patient health services for gynaecological examination.

intervention.description: Endocervical samples collection during routine gynaecological examinations.

study_pop.textblock: Women >= 18 attending out-patient departments of primary, secondary or tertiary care centres for gynaecological examination and agreeing to provide a cervical sample for human papillomavirus testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women >= 18 years of age attending a clinic for gynaecological examination.
- Women who agree to provide a cervical sample for human papillomavirus testing.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Referral for abnormal cervical sample at the current visit.
- Abundant menstrual bleeding or vaginal discharge not allowing appropriate screening to be performed.
- History of hysterectomy.
- Known diagnosis of immunosuppression, or patient on immunosuppressives.
- Pregnant women.
- Having received one or more doses of HPV vaccine prior to participating in the study.
